author: Rhiannon Williams
title: Apple updates iPod touch range with new colours
text: Apple has updated its iPod range, complete with access to new streaming service Apple Music. The newly updated iPod touch features an 8MP iSight camera and A8 chip for faster graphics performance - the same specifications as the iPhone 6 - and the newly launched Apple Music app via iOS 8.4. The newly updated iPod touch range Shoppers can now choose from space grey, silver, gold, pink and blue versions, which are now on sale from £159 for the 16GB model, £199 for 32GB and £249 for 64GB. The new colour spectrum has also been extended to the iPod nano and shuffle product lines. The iPod nano range has been given a colourful makeover As have the iPod shuffles The release comes as Apple has turned its focus to iPhones over iPods in recent years, after sales of the smartphone overtook the music player in 2010. The iPod was credited with revolutionising the portable music player market following its launch in 2001, shifting more than 250 million units worldwide by 2012, but sales have fallen as consumers increasingly store and listen to music through their smartphones over the separate device. Chief executive Tim Cook admitted in February last year that Apple “have known for some time that iPod is a declining business ”, with the company quietly ending production of the iPod Classic in September. Apple’s contactless payment system Apple Pay was launched in the UK on Tuesday, allowing iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus and Apple Watch owners to make payments and travel around London’s Tube, rail and bus networks using their devices. Users can register their credit or debit cards through their iPhone, which uses its inbuilt near-field communication chip and Touch ID fingerprint scanner to verify your identity and complete the transaction.
